{include "affiliate_loader"} There's no reproductive freedom without rights, equity, and access. {include "pre-header-spacing"} {*Remove beacon from text version only.*} {beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

At a time when states are rushing to push reproductive health care out of reach, New Jersey can lead by stepping up to protect reproductive freedom and remove barriers to access for all people who need birth control or pregnancy-related care, including abortion.

Now is the time to tell your state lawmakers: New Jersey can safeguard one of our most fundamental rights and prioritize the health and well-being of all communities by passing the RFA.

Take Action

The Garden State has a long history of advancing reproductive rights. But, there is also a long history of the ways that reproductive freedom has been denied to those in Black, brown, immigrant, low-income, and LGBTQ+ communities.

For many, the right to access essential reproductive health care services and the freedom to make reproductive health care decisions about what's best for themselves and their families is still out of reach. That's not reproductive freedom.

The RFA ensures that anyone who can become pregnant can access high-quality and affordable reproductive health care and has the freedom to make deeply personal decisions about when or whether to have a child.

The New Jersey Legislature will meet next week. We have a chance to urge them now to take action and move the bill forward. Legislators need to hear from you to advance this key protection for New Jerseyans. Join us and urge lawmakers to support the Reproductive Freedom Act (RFA).

In solidarity,

{if affiliate_ed_src}

{/if}

Sarah Fajardo
Policy Director, ACLU of {affiliate_name}
